Articles.Content:
As if the Devs and Maintainers don't already have enough to do...

I visited the Wiki page for KSP, hoping to find some answers on key bindings and new parts, but I find it is very much-so out of date. So I guess this is a request for one more thing to be added to the To-Do List ... please update the [Wiki](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Main_Page). ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
That's up to us. Squad has nothing to do with the wiki.

Is it open to contribution? Because I'm sure there's plenty within the community that would love to add aspects to the Wiki. Me being one of them.

EDIT: Ah, I see.
Why do people assume that a wiki is not open to contributions?
Is there any actual official documentation?

> 
> Is there any actual official documentation?

You mean like a manual?

I dont think so, as KSP is still in development.
I did a hell of a job there and then just stopped because with each update lots of things needed to be rewritten and that means sifting through the content to get all right.

I only bring it up because there are new parts, and parts that function differently, and key bindings which have changed. I know KSP has been under development, but it is after all *out of beta now*. As **lajoswinkler** points out, there's a lot of content to be reviewed; Maybe it's time for a call for volunteers/submissions for a Wiki update?

Most of the Wiki can be edited by anyone, but the front page is moderators-only. Which is a shame, since it's barely been touched since 0.19. Needless to say, it's badly in need of some updates, but that's not something many of us can do.
